articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Reply Messages to Foreign Heads of State
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Reply Messages to Foreign Heads of State
 Pyongyang, May 14 (KCNA) -- Respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un sent messages to heads of state of different countries in reply to their congratulations on the occasion of the Day of the Sun.
					 The reply messages went to Bashar Al-Assad, president of Syria, Obiang Nguema Mbasogo, president of Equatorial Guinea, and Joseph Kabila Kabange, president of Democratic Congo.
					
					 In the messages the Supreme Leader expressed thanks to those presidents for their heartfelt congratulations and wishes to him on the 105th birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 He wished them successes in the work for their countries' peace, stability and prosperity, expressing belief that the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the DPRK and the said countries would grow stronger.

articles.title: Congratulations to Cambodian King
articles.content:
Congratulations to Cambodian King
 Pyongyang, May 14 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Sunday sent a congratulatory message to Norodom Sihamoni, king of Cambodia, on his 64th birthday.
					 Kim in the message wished the king good health and happiness and bigger success in his work, expressing the belief that the historic and traditional relations of friendship between the two countries, established by President Kim Il Sung and great King Norodom Sihanouk, would steadily grow stronger.

articles.title: New Vice-Premier Appointed
articles.content:
New Vice-Premier Appointed
 Pyongyang, May 14 (KCNA) -- Tong Jong Ho was appointed as vice-premier of the DPRK Cabinet, according to a May 13 decree of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Mexican Party Leader
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Mexican Party Leader
 Pyongyang, May 14 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, chairman of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK), received a congratulatory message from Alberto Anaya Gutierrez, national leader of the Workers' Party of Mexico (WPM), on May 8.
					 The message said:
					
					 I'd love to extend the warmest congratulations and comradely greetings, on behalf of all the WPM members and on my own behalf, to you on the anniversary of your election as chairman of the WPK.
					
					 During the visit to the DPRK last April, I could for myself witness the incredible military strength and the might of single-minded unity achieved by the WPK under your wise leadership.
					
					 We take this opportunity to heartily wish you leading the WPK and the Democratic People's Republic of Korea bigger success in your noble work, expressing belief that the WPK will always win victories in the struggle to defend socialism and build an economic power thanks to your guidance.

articles.title: Start of Project for Building C1 Chemical Industry in DPRK
articles.content:
Start of Project for Building C1 Chemical Industry in DPRK
 Pyongyang, May 14 (KCNA) -- A project for building the C1 chemical industry starts in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 A ceremony for starting the project took place at the Sunchon Chemical Complex on Sunday.
					
					 Present there were Pak Pong Ju, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the C.C., Workers' Party of Korea, vice-chairman of the DPRK State Affairs Commission and premier of the Cabinet, O Su Yong, vice-chairman of the C.C., WPK, Ro Tu Chol, vice-premier and chairman of the State Planning Commission, Pak Thae Song, chairman of the South Phyongan Provincial Committee of the WPK, and others.
					
					 Jang Kil Ryong, minister of Chemical Industry, addressed the ceremony.

articles.title: Those Who Hurt Dignity of Supreme Leadership of DPRK Will Not Survive: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Those Who Hurt Dignity of Supreme Leadership of DPRK Will Not Survive: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, May 14 (KCNA) -- The army and people of the DPRK, enraged at serious state-sponsored terrorism plotted by the U.S. and the south Korean puppet forces, are turning out in the just war on terrorism to reduce to ashes the plot-hatching center of the enemy, says Rodong Sinmun in an article on Sunday.
					 It goes on:
					
					 The recent hideous terrorist plot by use of biochemical substance is the most vicious challenge and a declaration of war against the leader whom the Korean people regard as their spiritual mainstay and eternal sun. 
					
					 This is an inevitable product and culmination of the hostile policy of the U.S. and the puppet group of traitors towards the DPRK and their confrontational moves against the reunification.
					
					 Their recourse to such terrorism virtually means the start of a total war against the DPRK.
					
					 It is the unanimous demand of all the service members and civilians of the DPRK that the intelligence and plot-breeding centers of the U.S. and the south Korea, groups of most base and vicious terrorists, should be blown up to their very foundation.
					
					 It is not necessary to give warning to those plotters. The groups of criminals should be wiped out by baptism of revenge fire so that no one would be left to sign a document of apology.
					
					 As already declared, our army and people will blow up the plot-breeding centers to ashes so that those who dared hurt the dignity of their supreme leadership can no longer survive.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Raps S. Korean Conservative Group's Moves to Turn back Wheel of History
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Raps S. Korean Conservative Group's Moves to Turn back Wheel of History
 Pyongyang, May 14 (KCNA) -- The conservative group of south Korea, hated and forsaken by the people, is foolish enough to rally the conservative forces scattered, unaware of its poor position. What they did was betrayed during the recent presidential election.
					 The "Liberal Korea Party" ran amuck to take power again by dragging its conservative betes noires in the election.
					
					 This is nothing but the desperate efforts of the conservative forces to turn back the wheel of history by rallying those more dead than alive, sentenced to death by the people, Rodong Sinmun Sunday says in a commentary, adding:
					
					 The conservative group's reckless deeds are an intolerable insult and challenge to the broad strata of candlelight demonstrators in south Korea.
					
					 The conservative group let Park Geun Hye, root cause of misfortune, come to power and backed her treacherous policies, irregularities and influence-peddling operation, thus causing the unprecedented political scandal and turning the society into shambles. This group of criminals should disappear from the stage of history, with responsibility for such terrific crimes.
					
					 As long as there remain the conservative forces trying to attain their silly ambition, the south Korean people can never realize their wishes.
					
					 It is the lesson of history and the present reality that the south Korean people will not escape from misfortune and sufferings when the conservative group rules the roost.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Hits at Japan's Scheme for Overseas Expansion
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Hits at Japan's Scheme for Overseas Expansion
 Pyongyang, May 14 (KCNA) -- The Japanese prime minister told, at an event recently held to mark the 70th enforcement anniversary of the constitution, that it is needed to amend the current constitution as the security environment had changed because of the DPRK's nuclear and missile development.
					 Meanwhile, Japan's "Self-Defense Forces" launched a joint military drill with the U.S., Britain and France in the territorial waters of Japan and the Pacific.
					
					 Commenting on the facts, Rodong Sinmun says it is a revelation of Japan's sinister scheme to continue aggravate the regional situation, pursuant to the aggression war moves of its American master, and shake off the yoke of a defeated country and realize its overseas expansion ambition.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries have long employed all sorts of sleight of hand to retrogressively revive the constitution, with an object to retake the rights of belligerency and participation in a war and make Japan a "normal state" capable of going to war, the daily notes, adding:
					
					 What the Japanese reactionaries seek in the retrogressive revision of the constitution is to turn the SDF into the army in the past when Japan invaded other countries with the wild daydream of "Greater East Asia Co-Prosperity Sphere" and thus pave the road to overseas expansion.
					
					 Through the joint military exercises Japan also seeks a sinister political aim to describe itself as a normal state which can carry out a collective military action with its enemy states in the Second World War.
					
					 The DPRK is the first target of Japan in realizing its reinvasion ambition.
					
					 Japan can never be a full-fledged member state of the international community through the amendment to the constitution and military drills. It would be well advised not to forget the lesson of history but to honestly reflect on its past crimes.

articles.title: WFTU Presidential Council Meeting Adopts Resolution on Solidarity with Korean Working People
articles.content:
WFTU Presidential Council Meeting Adopts Resolution on Solidarity with Korean Working People
 Pyongyang, May 14 (KCNA) -- The meeting of the Presidential Council of the World Federation of Trade Unions (WFTU), held in Havana of Cuba, adopted a resolution on solidarity with the working people of the DPRK on May 4.
					 The resolution praised the DPRK as a socialist state guided by the Juche idea, where the broad working masses are the masters of the state power and the production means and everything in the society serves them.
					
					 It referred to the fact that a vigorous drive for creating Mallima Speed is going on in the DPRK to victoriously advance people-centered socialism with the great spirit of self-reliance and self-development as the dynamic force.
					
					 It condemned the U.S. and the south Korean puppet forces for staging the largest-ever nuclear war drills to drive the situation of the Korean peninsula to the brink of a war and hinder its reunification, the unanimous desire of the Korean nation.
					
					 The resolution said:
					
					 WFTU extends full support and solidarity to the working people of the DPRK in the struggle to build a socialist power through a dynamic all-people offensive for the Conference of Mallima Frontrunners under the wise guidance of respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un and reunify the country independently as soon as possible.
					
					 WFTU scathingly denounces the U.S. and south Korea for their nuclear war exercises against the DPRK which prevent the reunification of the Korean peninsula and pose a serious threat to the peace and security of the world, and strongly demands that the U.S. withdraw its aggression forces from south Korea, replace the armistice agreement by a peace accord and make a bold decision to roll back its anachronistic hostile policy towards the DPRK.
					
					 It appeals to all its member organizations and friendly bodies to extend invariable support and solidarity to the workers and other working masses of the DPRK in their just struggle for national reunification and peace and prosperity.

articles.title: World Media Observe Kim Il Sung's Birth Anniversary
articles.content:
World Media Observe Kim Il Sung's Birth Anniversary
 Pyongyang, May 14 (KCNA) -- Media of Cambodia, Syria and Guinea gave special write-ups to the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The Cambodian newspaper Nokor Thom Daily devoted one whole page to an article titled "Sunny smile" with a portrait of smiling Kim Il Sung, which said that his smile reflects confidence and optimism about the rosy future of socialist Korea.
					
					 Cambodia's AKP and broadcasting services introduced what personages of different countries have said in praise of the President's exploits and personality as a great man, stressing that he is a prominent elder statesman in the 20th century as he founded the Juche idea to show the road ahead of mankind and steered the cause of global independence under the banner of independence against imperialism.
					
					 Syria's Central TV Channel broadcasted records showing the revolutionary activities of the President and scenes on the achievements made by the Korean people in building a socialist power.
					
					 The Syrian Arab News Agency (SANA) and the Central Broadcasting Service carried special reports on his noble life devoted to the country and the people.
					
					 The Syrian newspaper Al Baath in an article titled "DPRK celebrates the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung" noted that the progressive people have celebrated the birth anniversary of the President with splendor as a holiday common to mankind every year.
					
					 Another papers Al Thawrah and Tishrin carried articles under such titles as "105th birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung, founder of the DPRK".
					
					 The Guinean newspaper Horoya praised the lifetime of the President in several articles illustrated with a portrait of smiling Kim Il Sung.
					
					 Broadcasting services of Guinea introduced the fact that the President rendered material and moral assistance to the national liberation struggle and building of a new society in African countries as well as Kimilsungia which came to birth as an immortal flower.
